  specialized The imperfect form of a verb describes an action in the past that was continuous or was not completed: in the imperfect In the sentence "He was hit by a car as he was crossing the road", the verb "cross" is in the imperfect form.

  specialized
in some languages, the form of a verb that is used for an action that has not been completed in the past, used, for example, to refer to an action that was happening when it was suddenly interrupted, or to describe an existing situation at the beginning of a story: in the imperfect In the sentence "He was hit by a car as he was crossing the road", the verb "cross" is in the imperfect.
